title: Bavarian Sauerkraut
ingredients: 2 tablespoons firmly packed light brown sugar
½ stick (¼ cup) plus 2 tablespoons butter
½ teaspoons Marmite (available at specialty food shops)
½ teaspoons Bovril (available at specialty food shops)
instructions: Open a 13-ounce jar of sauerkraut and pour it into a colander; rinse it well under cold running water then shake out as much of the water as possible and allow it to drain awhile you continue.
In an 8-inch enamel saucepan cook 2 tablespoons of firmly packed light brown sugar in ½ stick butter over moderately high heat, stirring, for about 10 minutes; or, until it has begun to caramelize.

Reduce the heat to low and add 1 cup of chopped onion.  Cook this mixture, stirring occasionally, for 10 to 15 minutes; or, until the onion is very soft.  Add 2 tablespoons of butter to the cooked onions; stir until its melted then add the sauerkraut and cook the mixture, stirring, for 10 minutes.  Stir in the beef broth and add the Marmite and Bovril, cover, and cook the mixture, stirring occasionally, for 45 minutes.  When done transfer the sauerkraut to a heated serving dish and bring to the table.
Source:  Gourmet Holidays: , by Lillian Langseth-Christensen, Gourmet Magazine, January 1978.
